resources.string: The home screen contains buttons to launch the tools. The Stop (red) Button is at the bottom right corner. The menu button in to the top right corner. The menu contains How to Use, About App, Contact Us and Settings options. On the Settings screen you get options to change preferences and give permissions to the app.
In the Settings screen, click on the toggles to grant the permission. Once it is granted the toggle will be disabled. You can revoke the permissions through phone settings.

Tap the button to launch a floating toggle on the screen’s edge. You can drag it anywhere. Tap the toggle to use the tool or perform the action. Active toggles turn their buttons red. Calculator and Notepad save your work automatically. Launching the screenshot toggle will prompt you to give media projection permission. More usage info and functionality of the toggles can be found below.

IMPORTANT: For Notepad and Sticky Notes, tap the check button after typing to exit edit mode.
To stop a toggle, tap its button again or drag it to the bottom of the screen. You can also use the Stop button to close all toggles. Mirror and Sticky Notes have their own close buttons.

Mute: Mutes and restores media volume.
Brightness: Reduces and restores brightness.
Alert Toggle: Toggles between Ring, Vibrate and Silent modes.
DND: Toggles DND mode on and off.
Font Size: Maximizes and restores the system font size.
Timer: Tap to start/stop, long press to reset. Allows custom time.
Stopwatch: Tap to start/stop, long press to reset.
Screen On: Prevents screen from dimming when active.
Mirror: Uses front camera to feed to function as a mirror.
Flashlight: Turns phone flashlight on and off.
Calculator: Opens and closes a basic floating calculator.
Notepad: Opens and closes floating notepad.
Sticky Notes: Launches new sticky note to the screen.
Screenshot: Takes a screenshot.

Floating Tools provides quick access floating tools that you can use from anywhere on your phone. Each tool appears as a movable toggle on your screen, letting you perform actions instantly without switching apps. You can enable or disable any tool with a single tap, and the app clearly shows which permissions are needed for each feature.

Once activated, the toggles stay accessible across all apps, making tasks like calculations, notes, or screen actions faster and easier. You can stop individual tools by tapping their buttons or dragging them to the bottom of the screen, or close everything at once using the Stop button. The app is designed to be simple, efficient, and always within reach.

• Customizing tool colors and looks
• Diary option to locally save notepad contents
• Floating Dock for cleaner user experience
Floating Tools is a Free and Open Source Software. An ad-free version of this app will be available on F-Droid app store. We encourage you to explore open source software and support developers!

Feel free to reach out to us with any feedback, bug reports and suggestions, or just drop a message to say hi! If you are a developer and want to contribute to the project, we encourage you to check out our Github repository.
Floating Tools needs certain permissions to work correctly. Overlay permission is essential, but you can grant all permissions anytime from your app settings and revoke them from device settings.
